biography.intro: Born on January 7, 1945, in Maseno, Kisumu County, Raila Amolo Odinga is the son of Kenya's first Vice President, Jaramogi Oginga Odinga, and Mary Ajuma Odinga.
biography.education: After completing his education at the University of Magdeburg, where he earned a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Raila returned to Kenya in 1970.
biography.political: His political journey has been marked by personal sacrifice, including years of detention without trial (1982-1988) for his fight against authoritarian rule.
biography.current: Today, as the African Union High Representative for Infrastructure Development, Raila continues to champion pan-African unity, economic integration, and sustainable development across the continent.
